main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) occurred near the Erding Air Depot in Germany on 29th October 1952, with witnesses reporting silver-colored circular objects moving at high speeds and displaying unusual flight characteristics.
interesting points: The UFO sightings were reported by airmen, soldiers, and civilian observers, including USAF pilots and staff sergeants, providing a variety of credible witnesses.
The observed objects were described as circular or disc-shaped, silver in color, and estimated to be about the size of a small automobile.
Witnesses reported that the UFOs exhibited fast, silent, and steady movements, as well as sudden changes in direction and altitude, without any associated sound or exhaust.
Photographs were taken during one of the sightings, providing potential visual evidence of the UFO activity.
No known meteorological conditions or other celestial activity could explain the observed phenomena, and radar observations did not yield any conclusive results.
witnesses: Multiple credible witnesses including airmen, soldiers, and civilian observers
